image.altText: A young man in a button-up shirt, walking out of court while holding a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: The case of hit-and-run driver Jake Danby has brought renewed focus to the NT's legal system and the problems it faces. But will changing sentencing laws help?

title.children: Fatal hit-and-run brings NT's sentencing laws into spotlight for review

image.altText: A woman with a short dark brown bob, wearing a bright purple shirt, sits in an office looking off with a steely gaze.

props.synopsis: Asta Hill's grief over the tragic death of her younger brother 10 years ago is still raw, but the sad event is part of her story of connection to Alice Springs and hope for the outback town.

title.children: New Alice Springs mayor tells of family tragedy that brought her home

image.altText: A older woman sitting on wooden stage floor, with young woman in her lap, blankets over the girl and pillow for her head.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old dancer was left waiting for an ambulance for more than six hours after dislocating her knee during a competition in the Darwin CBD.

title.children: Darwin dancer with dislocated knee left waiting six hours for ambulance

image.altText: A sign for the Alice Springs Correctional Centre.

props.synopsis: Calls are mounting for the Northern Territory government to improve facilities and conditions at the Alice Springs Correctional Centre as the region prepares for another hot summer.Â

title.children: Church leader says Alice Springs jail conditions are 'inhumane'

image.altText: A red and white sign which reads MS with South Australia & Northern Territory underneath in black letters

props.synopsis: Non-profit organisation MS Society SA & NT, which supports almost 3,000 clients living with multiple sclerosis, has gone into voluntary administration.

title.children: Non-profit multiple sclerosis support agency in voluntary administration

image.altText: A close up of Roland Bull wearing a brown wide brimmed hat and leaning back against a patterned towel.

props.synopsis: As a doctor who advocates for self-care it took me a surprisingly long time to look after myself. Now I'm trying to be a good example for my patients and other doctors. Â  Â Â

title.children: As a doctor, I bang on about self-care â I'm finally taking my own advice

image.altText: A male police officer in uniform and a woman in a pink dress

props.synopsis: The autopsy into the Aboriginal man's death in custody in Alice Springs has been completed, with the police brief of evidence handed to prosecutors to determine whether any charges should be laid.Â

title.children: Kumanjayi White autopsy completed, brief of evidence handed to prosecutors

image.altText: Security cameras on a pole behind a razor wire fence.

props.synopsis: NT police data show crime rates in the NT are moving in two directions, with violent crime increasing and property crime decreasing.Â

title.children: Here's what the latest police figures reveal about crime rates in the NT

image.altText: A stack of pills on a table

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's advice that pregnant women should limit the use of paracetamol in pregnancy has been criticised as "baseless". So what does it mean for you?

title.children: Why Australian experts say Trump's autism claims are 'baseless'

image.altText: A light brown beetle and smaller brown larvae pictured in a microscopic picture with grains of rice in background.

props.synopsis: The estimated cost of the invasive khapra beetle to Australia's grains industry could be more than $15 billion if it became endemic across the country after being discovered in imported nappy pants.

title.children: Pest found in nappy pants could cost grains industry $15b if not contained

image.altText: An AFLW player looks serious as she walks off the field with two teammates behind her at half-time.

props.synopsis: Former AFLW player claims she was spat at during her community grand final as ex-players are being targeted at local leagues.

title.children: Former AFLW player alleges she was spat at during local league grand final

image.altText: A composite image with headshots of Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: The US president's itinerary for his 24-hour visit to New York makes no mention of Anthony Albanese, all but confirming a one-on-one will not be happening.

title.children: White House all but confirms no meeting between Albanese, Trump

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: The first sign something was wrong came late on Friday afternoon. Now we have a clearer picture of how the triple-0 outage unfolded.Â

title.children: How the Optus triple-0 outage unfolded

image.altText: Sarah, the Duchess of York, walking out wearing a white and black blazer, waving at the crowd with a black glove on her hand.

props.synopsis: The decisions come after British media reported that the Duchess had described the disgraced financier as a "steadfast, generous and supreme friend" in a 2011 letter.

title.children: Multiple charities cut ties with Duchess of York over email to Epstein

image.altText: Hannah Thomas with eye patch in black hoodie

props.synopsis: Hannah Thomas was among a group of pro-Palestinian protesters who demonstrated outside a manufacturing facility in June when she sustained a serious eye injury during her arrest for failing to comply with a move on direction.

title.children: NSW Police officer charged with assault over arrest of former Greens candidate

image.altText: A man sits at a desk.

props.synopsis: The Australian Securities and Investments Commission took Dave Hodgson and two of his companies to the Federal Court, alleging they were operating without the required financial services licence, and had made misrepresentations to investors.Â

title.children: Judge finds businessman had 'magic pudding' approach to valuing company

image.altText: The blue lettering of RACQ on the corner of a white building.

props.synopsis: The corporate watchdog alleges RACQ knowingly misled over 500,000 customers in insurance renewal notices since 2019.

title.children: Watchdog takes insurer to court over 'misleading' renewal notices

image.altText: Commuters board a Sydney train

props.synopsis: A scathing report into Sydney Trains has put a "disturbing" spotlight on the "absence of effective communications" and "information voids" on the network, but one transport expert says this was not always the case.

title.children: The key change that could make Sydney train commuters' lives easier

image.altText: Awamr of bees partially covers a footpath sign advertising dumplings.

props.synopsis: Thousands of bees appear without warning in the regional city, alarming locals and causing a commotion.

title.children: 'People running through the street' as bees swarm Wagga Wagga CBD

image.altText: A woman in a red sweater looks at the camera as she leaves a court building followed by a man and another woman

props.synopsis: Cedric and Noelene Jordan's attempt to overturn their conviction for the murder of their former son-in-law in 2009 has failed, with the Court of Criminal Appeal rejecting it on all grounds.

title.children: 'Not a scintilla of reasonable doubt': Court rejects killer couple's appeal

image.altText: A woman sits with her head down

props.synopsis: Hakyung Lee admitted to giving her two children an overdose of prescription medicine before changing her name and leaving New Zealand.

title.children: Mother found guilty of murdering two children found in suitcases

image.altText: A police car park next to a sign that says "park entrance"

props.synopsis: One of the youngest Australians ever to be charged with murder will face a jury trial over the stabbing death in a Hervey Bay caravan park of a 24-year-old man in August 2024.

title.children: Court hears girl to stand trial for murder told mother she 'stabbed a paedo'

image.altText: A small white capsule tablet sits in between rulers measuring its size, which have "CanTEST" written on them.

props.synopsis: The capsuled white powder was presented to the pill-testing site on Friday and, when chemists there couldn't make an identification, transferred to the Australian National University for analysis.

title.children: Rare nitazene found in Canberra believed to be Australian first

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel with hands out, wearing a suit and bow tie, standing on stage, brown background

props.synopsis: US comedian Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show will be reinstated after being taken off air, following remarks he made referencing right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

title.children: Jimmy Kimmel to go back on air after Charlie Kirk comments

image.altText: Sean 'Diddy' Combs

props.synopsis: The disgraced hip-hop mogul is expected to be sentenced on October 3.

title.children: Diddy's lawyers pitch shorter prison term, therapy ahead of sentence

image.altText: Rodrigo Duterte' in a white jacket, with red stripes, smiles, looking sideways, face reflected in a glass pane behind.

props.synopsis: Former president of the Philippines, Rodrigo Duterte, is accused of being involved in the murder of dozens of people.

title.children: ICC charges Philippines former leader with crimes against humanity

image.altText: Black and white photo of two people smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian kitchen manufacturer says a scammer has tried to extort money to remove several fake one-star reviews posted to Google.

title.children: SA business asked to pay $US200 to remove fake one-star Google reviews

image.altText: A composite image of two boys, one in a white shirt and one in a collared shirt and dark puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: Police charge a 15-year-old boy with the murder of Dau Akueng, also 15, who was found with fatal injuries alongside his 12-year-old friend Chol Achiek in Melbourne's outer west earlier this month.

image.altText: A Melbourne Storm player stands on the sidelines wearing a jacket with a hood on.

title.children: Storm include injured star Hughes with NRL grand final on the line

image.altText: A flock of sheep on an outback station.

props.synopsis: The WA government has finally signed off on the sale of Australia's largest sheep station almost seven months after UK-based Consolidated Pastoral Company announced plans to buy Rawlinna Station.

title.children: Sale of Australia's biggest sheep station at Rawlinna approved

image.altText: A happy woman with grey hair embraces her smiling son with an excited crowd looking on.

props.synopsis: Pro-democracy activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah has been released from prison, following a pardon from the Egyptian president.

title.children: Egyptian activist who helped Peter Greste released from jail

image.altText: a satellite map with several red markers indicating where a noise has been heard

props.synopsis: One sleepless resident said he drove around his local area to find the source of the disturbance.Â

title.children: 'They can't sleep': Humming sound keeping Sydney residents awake

image.altText: Kevin Spacey sits at a table in a blue chequered flannel shirt

props.synopsis: He's a prolific fixture on our screens who's famously six degrees from almost anyone. But Kevin Bacon is also a passionate musician and philanthropist.

title.children: Farming, music and philanthropy â there's more than just six degrees of Kevin Bacon
